chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
K: Ring
V: ModuleSpace K

Goal:
forall (x : K) (u : V), scal (opp x) u = opp (scal x u)

Premises:
scal = ModuleSpace.scal K (AbelianGroup.Pack V (ModuleSpace.class K V) V) (ModuleSpace.class K V) : K -> V -> V
opp = fun G : AbelianGroup => AbelianGroup.opp G (AbelianGroup.class G) : forall G : AbelianGroup, G -> G Argument G is implicit and maximally inserted
Notation ModuleSpace := ModuleSpace.type
ModuleSpace.Mixin : forall (K : Ring) (V : AbelianGroup) (scal : K -> V -> V), (forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal x (scal y u) = scal (mult x y) u) -> (forall u : V, scal one u = u) -> (forall (x : K) (u v : V), scal x (plus u v) = plus (scal x u) (scal x v)) -> (forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal (plus x y) u = plus (scal x u) (scal y u)) -> ModuleSpace.mixin_of K V
Record mixin_of (K : Ring) (V : AbelianGroup) : Type := Mixin { scal : K -> V -> V; ax1 : forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal x (scal y u) = scal (mult x y) u; ax2 : forall u : V, scal one u = u; ax3 : forall (x : K) (u v : V), scal x (plus u v) = plus (scal x u) (scal x v); ax4 : forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal (plus x y) u = plus (scal x u) (scal y u) } For Mixin: Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope]
scal_assoc : forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal x (scal y u) = scal (mult x y) u
scal_distr_l : forall (x : K) (u v : V), scal x (plus u v) = plus (scal x u) (scal x v)
scal_distr_r : forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal (plus x y) u = plus (scal x u) (scal y u)
opp_opp : forall x : ?G, opp (opp x) = x where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
opp_plus : forall x y : ?G, opp (plus x y) = plus (opp x) (opp y) where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
ModuleSpace.ax1 : forall (K : Ring) (V : AbelianGroup) (m : ModuleSpace.mixin_of K V) (x y : K) (u : V), ModuleSpace.scal K V m x (ModuleSpace.scal K V m y u) = ModuleSpace.scal K V m (mult x y) u
ModuleSpace.ax3 : forall (K : Ring) (V : AbelianGroup) (m : ModuleSpace.mixin_of K V) (x : K) (u v : V), ModuleSpace.scal K V m x (plus u v) = plus (ModuleSpace.scal K V m x u) (ModuleSpace.scal K V m x v)
ModuleSpace.ax4 : forall (K : Ring) (V : AbelianGroup) (m : ModuleSpace.mixin_of K V) (x y : K) (u : V), ModuleSpace.scal K V m (plus x y) u = plus (ModuleSpace.scal K V m x u) (ModuleSpace.scal K V m y u)
opp_mult_l : forall x y : ?K, opp (mult x y) = mult (opp x) y where ?K : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- Ring]
ModuleSpace.ax2 : forall (K : Ring) (V : AbelianGroup) (m : ModuleSpace.mixin_of K V) (u : V), ModuleSpace.scal K V m one u = u
opp_mult_m1 : forall x : ?K, opp x = mult (opp one) x where ?K : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- Ring]
opp_mult_r : forall x y : ?K, opp (mult x y) = mult x (opp y) where ?K : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- Ring]
plus_opp_l : forall x : ?G, plus (opp x) x = zero where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
abs_opp : forall x : ?K, abs (opp x) = abs x where ?K : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbsRing]
plus_opp_r : forall x : ?G, plus x (opp x) = zero where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
scal_one : forall u : V, scal one u = u
scal_zero_l : forall u : V, scal zero u = zero
sum_n_mult_l : forall (a : ?K) (u : nat -> ?K) (n : nat), sum_n (fun k : nat => mult a (u k)) n = mult a (sum_n u n) where ?K : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- Ring]
sum_n_mult_r : forall (a : ?K) (u : nat -> ?K) (n : nat), sum_n (fun k : nat => mult (u k) a) n = mult (sum_n u n) a where ?K : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- Ring]
opp_minus : forall x y : ?G, opp (minus x y) = minus y x where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
sum_n_m_mult_l : forall (a : ?K) (u : nat -> ?K) (n m : nat), sum_n_m (fun k : nat => mult a (u k)) n m = mult a (sum_n_m u n m) where ?K : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- Ring]
sum_n_m_mult_r : forall (a : ?K) (u : nat -> ?K) (n m : nat), sum_n_m (fun k : nat => mult (u k) a) n m = mult (sum_n_m u n m) a where ?K : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- Ring]
Ring.ax2 : forall (K : AbelianGroup) (m : Ring.mixin_of K) (x : K), Ring.mult K m x (Ring.one K m) = x
Ring.ax3 : forall (K : AbelianGroup) (m : Ring.mixin_of K) (x : K), Ring.mult K m (Ring.one K m) x = x
AbsRing.ax5 : forall (K : Ring) (m : AbsRing.mixin_of K) (x : K), AbsRing.abs K m x = 0 -> x = zero
opp_zero = fun G : AbelianGroup => eq_ind (plus (opp zero) zero) (fun s : G => s = zero) (plus_opp_l zero) (opp zero) (plus_zero_r (opp zero)) : forall G : AbelianGroup, opp zero = zero Argument G is implicit and maximally inserted
abs_opp_one = fun K : AbsRing => AbsRing.ax2 K (AbsRing.class K) : forall K : AbsRing, abs (opp one) = 1 Argument K is implicit and maximally inserted
Record mixin_of (G : Type) : Type := Mixin { plus : G -> G -> G; opp : G -> G; zero : G; ax1 : forall x y : G, plus x y = plus y x; ax2 : forall x y z : G, plus x (plus y z) = plus (plus x y) z; ax3 : forall x : G, plus x zero = x; ax4 : forall x : G, plus x (opp x) = zero } For mixin_of: Argument scope is [type_scope] For Mixin: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope function_scope _ function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope]
Ring.ax5 : forall (K : AbelianGroup) (m : Ring.mixin_of K) (x y z : K), Ring.mult K m x (plus y z) = plus (Ring.mult K m x y) (Ring.mult K m x z)
scal_zero_r : forall x : K, scal x zero = zero
Ring.ax1 : forall (K : AbelianGroup) (m : Ring.mixin_of K) (x y z : K), Ring.mult K m x (Ring.mult K m y z) = Ring.mult K m (Ring.mult K m x y) z
Ring.ax4 : forall (K : AbelianGroup) (m : Ring.mixin_of K) (x y z : K), Ring.mult K m (plus x y) z = plus (Ring.mult K m x z) (Ring.mult K m y z)
Rinv_pow : forall (x : R) (n : nat), x <> 0 -> / x ^ n = (/ x) ^ n
powerRZ_neg : forall (x : R) (alpha : Z), x <> R0 -> powerRZ x (- alpha) = powerRZ (/ x) alpha
pow_n_comm_1 : forall (x : ?K) (n : nat), mult (pow_n x n) x = mult x (pow_n x n) where ?K : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- Ring]
AbelianGroup.ax4 : forall (G : Type) (m : AbelianGroup.mixin_of G) (x : G), AbelianGroup.plus G m x (AbelianGroup.opp G m x) = AbelianGroup.zero G m
pow_n_plus : forall (x : ?K) (n m : nat), pow_n x (n + m) = mult (pow_n x n) (pow_n x m) where ?K : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- Ring]
pow_n_comm : forall (x : ?K) (n m : nat), mult (pow_n x n) (pow_n x m) = mult (pow_n x m) (pow_n x n) where ?K : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- Ring]

```coq
intros x u.
unfold opp.
unfold scal.
rewrite scal_assoc.
rewrite <- opp_mult_r.
reflexivity.
Qed.```

original: intros x u. unfold opp. unfold scal. rewrite scal_assoc. rewrite <- opp_mult_r. reflexivity.
